title: Blended Learning in Medical Education: Flipped Learning and 4Es Learning Cycle Application

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: A long-term course for pre-service and in-service teachers conducted in a smartphone-based microlearning environment. Recontextualizes medical education content through social studies integration to emphasize blended learning effectiveness.

learning_goals: Learners demonstrate the ability to design flipped learning-based classes in a blended learning environment with over 80% accuracy.
Learners restructure medical education content into social studies using the 4Es learning cycle (Engagement, Exploration, Explanation, Extension).
Learners develop at least three interactive microlearning modules using smartphone-based webinar tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
